content.html:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

Functions \(R\) and \(D\) give the height, in feet, of a toy rocket and a drone, \(t\) seconds after they are released.

Here are the graphs of \(R\) (for the rocket) and \(D\) (for the drone).

  1. Decide whether the following statements are true or false.
    1. \(R(3)>D(3)\)

Correct! True

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.9.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is true. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

    1. \(R(0)=D(0)\)

Correct! False

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.9.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is false. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

    1. \(R(4.5)=D(4.5)\)

Correct! True

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.9.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is true. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

    1. \(R(0)=D(0)+25\)

Correct! True

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.9.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is true. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

    1. \(D(7)>R(5)\)

Correct! False

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.9.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is false. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \(A(t)\) is the average high temperature in Aspen, Colorado, \(t\) months after the start of the year. \(M(t)\) is the average high temperature in Minneapolis, Minnesota, \(t\) months after the start of the year. Temperature is measured in degrees Fahrenheit.

    2. Which function had the higher average rate of change between the beginning of January and middle of March?

Correct! Minneapolis

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.9.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Minneapolis. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Here are two graphs representing functions \(f\) and \(g\).
    Select all statements that are true about functions \(f\) and \(g\).

Correct! There are values of \(x\) where \(f(x)=g(x)\), \(f(-1)<g(-1)\), and \(f(-3)>g(4)\).

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.9.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answers are: There are values of \(x\) where \(f(x)=g(x)\), \(f(-1)<g(-1)\), and \(f(-3)>g(4)\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

For questions 4–6, use the three graphs below:

The three graphs represent the progress of three runners in a 400-meter race.

The solid line represents Runner A. The dotted line represents Runner B. The dashed line represents Runner C.

  1. Which runner ran at a constant rate throughout the race?

Correct! Runner C

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.9.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Runner C. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which runner stopped running for a while?

Correct! Runner A

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.9.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Runner A. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which runner won the race?

Correct! Runner C

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.9.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Runner C. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

Use the graphs below for questions 7–8.

Show A                                             Show B                                   Show C

  1. Which show had the largest audience for episode 4?

Correct! Show B

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.9.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Show B. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which show had the largest audience for their first episode?

Correct! Show B

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.9.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Show B. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
